The '''house of Oromë''' was the dwelling of [[Oromë]] in [[Valinor]]. Few details of this house are told in the ''[[Quenta Silmarillion]]'', except that it was visited by [[Celegorm]], who there "''got great knowledge of birds and beasts''" and even learnt "''all their tongues''".<ref>{{S|5}}</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
<small>"''...his gate and tree-propped halls, the forest-god''"</small><ref name=LB/>

In early versions of the [[legendarium]], Oromë's house is also referred to as the '''halls of Oromë'''. It was located in [[Valmar]], the city of the [[Valar]] in [[Valinor]]. The halls were "''wide and low''", with walls and floor abundantly adorned with "''skins and pelts''" and "''spears and bows and knives''". A tree grew in the middle of each room (where dwelt Oromë's folk, clad in green and brown), holding up the roof.<ref name=LB>{{LB|C4}}, pp. 186 (line 892), 198</ref><ref>{{LT1|III}}, pp. 75-6</ref>
